analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi chos dkon mchog gi mdzod 'dzin pa dang / mtshan nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyi chos gang de bzhin gshegs pas mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi ngo bo nyid de'i chos thams cad yongs su 'dzin pa dang / thog ma nas sems can rnam par dag pas sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bgyid pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yang @334a *//
translated: They are the holders of the Dharma treasure of the blessed buddhas, and they uphold all phenomena that have the nature of characteristics, which the Thus-Gone One has fully awakened to.

original: dag par bsgrub pa'i slad du tshul bzhin du'ang rab tu sbyor ba rnams lags /
analyzed: dag par bsgrub pa'i slad du tshul bzhin du'ang rab tu sbyor ba rnams lags /
translated: They are those who, from the very beginning, purify sentient beings and bring all sentient beings to maturity, and who apply themselves properly in order to accomplish all the qualities of a buddha.

original: mngon par shes pa las ma nyams shing chos thams cad la dbang bgyid pa rnams lags /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa las ma nyams shing chos thams cad la dbang bgyid pa rnams lags /
translated: They are those who have not lost their superknowledges and have mastery over all phenomena.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis shin tu rtogs par dka' ba'i chos kyi tshul zab mo la zhugs pa rnams lags /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis shin tu rtogs par dka' ba'i chos kyi tshul zab mo la zhugs pa rnams lags /
translated: They are those who have entered the profound Dharma way that is difficult for all śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas to understand.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la 'jug pa'i shes pa la mkhas te mtha' gnyis su lta ba thams cad dang bral ba rnams lags /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la 'jug pa'i shes pa la mkhas te mtha' gnyis su lta ba thams cad dang bral ba rnams lags /
translated: They are those who are skilled in the knowledge that engages with dependent origination and are free from all views of the two extremes.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i phyag rgyas btab pas de bzhin nyid dbyer med pa shes pa mkhas pa rnams lags /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i phyag rgyas btab pas de bzhin nyid dbyer med pa shes pa mkhas pa rnams lags /
translated: They are those who are skilled in the knowledge that the thusness of the thus-gone ones is inseparable.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi tshul la rab tu zhugs shing chos kyi dbyings thams cad la yang dag par gzhol pa rnams lags /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi tshul la rab tu zhugs shing chos kyi dbyings thams cad la yang dag par gzhol pa rnams lags /
translated: They are those who have entered the way of the realm of phenomena and are dedicated to all the realms of phenomena.

original: bsam pa rdo rje ltar sra zhing mi phyed de theg pa chen po 'di la legs par gnas shing mi g-yo ba rnams lags /
analyzed: bsam pa rdo rje ltar sra zhing mi phyed de theg pa chen po 'di la legs par gnas shing mi g-yo ba rnams lags /
translated: They are those whose intentions are as firm and unbreakable as a diamond, who are well established in this Great Vehicle and do not waver.

original: sangs rgyas kyi yul rjes su thob cing rang gi yul yongs su dag pa rnams lags /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi yul rjes su thob cing rang gi yul yongs su dag pa rnams lags /
translated: They have attained the domain of the buddhas and their own domain is pure.

original: gzungs thob pa rtag tu mi brjod par spyod pa rnams lags /
analyzed: gzungs thob pa rtag tu mi brjod par spyod pa rnams lags /
translated: They have attained retention and always practice without forgetting.

original: spobs pa thogs pa med pa rgyun mi chad la rtag tu sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis byin gyis brlabs pa rnams lags /
analyzed: spobs pa thogs pa med pa rgyun mi chad la rtag tu sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis byin gyis brlabs pa rnams lags /
translated: They have unimpeded and uninterrupted eloquence and are always blessed by the buddhas.

original: skye ba dang / 'chi 'pho ba dang / 'byung ba rnams la dbang thob pa rnams lags /
analyzed: skye ba dang / 'chi 'pho ba dang / 'byung ba rnams la dbang thob pa rnams lags /
translated: They have attained mastery over birth, death, and appearance.

original: bdud bzhi'i lam las yang dag par 'das shing @334b bdud dang phyir rgol ba thams cad bcom pa rnams lags /
analyzed: bdud bzhi'i lam las yang dag par 'das shing @334b bdud dang phyir rgol ba thams cad bcom pa rnams lags /
translated: They have transcended the path of the four māras and have defeated all māras and adversaries.

original: bsod nams kyis tshogs tshad med pa bsags shing sems can thams cad kyi 'tsho bar gyur pa rnams lags /
analyzed: bsod nams kyis tshogs tshad med pa bsags shing sems can thams cad kyi 'tsho bar gyur pa rnams lags /
translated: They have accumulated immeasurable merit and are the livelihood of all beings.

original: sangs rgyas rnams ma byung yang sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pas sems can rnams la nye bar gnas pa rnams lags /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams ma byung yang sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pas sems can rnams la nye bar gnas pa rnams lags /
translated: Even when the buddhas do not appear, they remain in the world to perform the deeds of the buddhas.

original: rgya mtsho'i phyag rgya'i ting nge 'dzin thob cing sems can thams cad kyi sems dang spyod pa la mi chags pa rnams lags /
analyzed: rgya mtsho'i phyag rgya'i ting nge 'dzin thob cing sems can thams cad kyi sems dang spyod pa la mi chags pa rnams lags /
translated: They have attained the samādhi of the ocean mudrā and are not attached to the minds and conduct of all beings.

original: chags pa thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa dang / nam mkha' la rlung dmar lta bu'i sems dang ldan pa rnams lags; cho ga dang spyod pa'i tshul shes pa dang / mun pa dang bral zhing snang ba thob pa rnams lags /
analyzed: chags pa thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa dang / nam mkha' la rlung dmar lta bu'i sems dang ldan pa rnams lags; cho ga dang spyod pa'i tshul shes pa dang / mun pa dang bral zhing snang ba thob pa rnams lags /
translated: They have completely transcended all attachments, have minds like the red winds in the sky, know the ways of conduct and rites, are free from darkness, and have attained illumination.

original: gzhan gyi dring la mi 'jog cing rang byung gi ye shes shin tu rtogs pa rnams lags /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dring la mi 'jog cing rang byung gi ye shes shin tu rtogs pa rnams lags /
translated: They are not dependent on others and have fully realized self-arisen wisdom.

original: myur du theg pa chen po las thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes 'di thob par 'gyur ba lags /
analyzed: myur du theg pa chen po las thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes 'di thob par 'gyur ba lags /
translated: They will quickly attain this omniscient wisdom of the Mahāyāna.

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nam mkha' mdzod la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //🔽skyes bu dam pa /
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nam mkha' mdzod la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to // skyes bu dam pa /
translated: When this was said, the Bhagavān said to the bodhisattva mahāsattva Ākāśagarbha, “Excellent, excellent, noble sir!

original: khyod legs so legs so //🔽skyes bu dam pa /
analyzed: khyod legs so legs so //🔽skyes bu dam pa /
translated: Excellent, noble sir!

original: khyod de bzhin gshegs pa la don 'di 'dri bar sems pa legs so //
analyzed: khyod de bzhin gshegs pa la don 'di 'dri bar sems pa legs so //
translated: “It is excellent that you have thought to ask the Tathāgata about this matter.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: khyod ni / sems can thams cad kyis gsol ba ma btab pa'i bshes gnyen sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la snang ba thob @335a *//
analyzed: khyod ni / sems can thams cad kyis gsol ba ma btab pa'i bshes gnyen sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la snang ba thob @335a *//
translated: You are a spiritual friend who is not requested to be a spiritual friend by all sentient beings, but who has attained the light of all the qualities of the Buddha.

original: pa; byams pa chen po dang snying rje chen po'i go cha bgos pa /
analyzed: pa; byams pa chen po dang snying rje chen po'i go cha bgos pa /
translated: You are armored in great love and great compassion.

original: bgrang ba las 'das pa'i sangs rgyas la bsnyen bkur byas pa /
analyzed: bgrang ba las 'das pa'i sangs rgyas la bsnyen bkur byas pa /
translated: You have served more than a countable number of buddhas.

original: rtag tu chos las mi dom pa; ye shes kyi mtshon cha can /
analyzed: rtag tu chos las mi dom pa; ye shes kyi mtshon cha can /
translated: You are always focused on the Dharma. You have the weapon of wisdom.

original: nga rgyal gyi rnam pa thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa /
analyzed: nga rgyal gyi rnam pa thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa /
translated: You have transcended all forms of pride.

original: rtag tu rgyun mi chad par sems can gyi don la brtson pa /
analyzed: rtag tu rgyun mi chad par sems can gyi don la brtson pa /
translated: You are always dedicated to the benefit of sentient beings.

original: 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad las yang dag par 'das pa /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad las yang dag par 'das pa /
translated: You have transcended the eight worldly concerns.

original: nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa'i sems kyis thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes yang dag par sgrub pa ste /
analyzed: nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa'i sems kyis thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes yang dag par sgrub pa ste /
translated: You have the sky-like mind that accomplishes omniscient wisdom.

original: skyes bu dam pa /
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa /
translated: You are a holy being.

original: khyod kyi yon tan rnams kyi mtha' rtogs par sla ba ma yin no //
analyzed: khyod kyi yon tan rnams kyi mtha' rtogs par sla ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not easy to fathom the extent of your good qualities.

original: de'i phyir rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: de'i phyir rigs kyi bu /
translated: Therefore, son of noble family,

original: khyod legs par rab tu nyon la yid la zungs shig dang / ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyis yon tan 'di rnams dang / gzhan dag kyang thob par 'gyur ba bshad do //🔽bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: khyod legs par rab tu nyon la yid la zungs shig dang / ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyis yon tan 'di rnams dang / gzhan dag kyang thob par 'gyur ba bshad do // bcom ldan 'das /
translated: listen well and keep it in mind, and I will explain how bodhisattva great beings can attain these and other good qualities.”🔽“Excellent, Blessed One!”

original: legs so // zhes gsol nas byang chub sems dpa' nam mkha' mdzod bcom ldan 'das kyi ltar nyan pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: legs so // zhes gsol nas byang chub sems dpa' nam mkha' mdzod bcom ldan 'das kyi ltar nyan pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: replied the bodhisattva Ākāśagarbha, and he listened as the Blessed One had instructed. The Blessed One said,

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Son of noble family,

original: chos bzhi dang ldan na /
analyzed: chos bzhi dang ldan na /
translated: if they have four qualities,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa yin te /
translated: bodhisattvas’ generosity is like space.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: bdag rnam par dag pas sems can rnam par dag pa la 'jug pa dang / sems can rnam par @335b dag pas sbyin pa rnam par dag pa la 'jug pa dang / sbyin pa rnam par dag pas bsngo ba rnam par dag pa la 'jug pa dang /
analyzed: bdag rnam par dag pas sems can rnam par dag pa la 'jug pa dang / sems can rnam par @335b dag pas sbyin pa rnam par dag pa la 'jug pa dang / sbyin pa rnam par dag pas bsngo ba rnam par dag pa la 'jug pa dang /
translated: the purity of beings through the purity of the self, the purity of generosity through the purity of beings, the purity of dedication through the purity of generosity,🔽

original: bsngo ba rnam par dag pas byang chub rnam par dag pa la 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: bsngo ba rnam par dag pas byang chub rnam par dag pa la 'jug pa ste /
translated: They engage in the purity of sentient beings through the purity of the self, they engage in the purity of generosity through the purity of sentient beings, they engage in the purity of dedication through the purity of generosity, and they engage in the purity of awakening through the purity of dedication.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: chos bzhi po de dag dang ldan na /
analyzed: chos bzhi po de dag dang ldan na /
translated: if bodhisattvas possess these four qualities,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa yin no //
translated: their generosity will be like space.

original: des rnam par dag pa brgyad kyi sgo nas sbyin pa de byin te /
analyzed: des rnam par dag pa brgyad kyi sgo nas sbyin pa de byin te /
translated: They give that generosity through the gateway of the eight purities.

original: brgyad gang zhe na /
analyzed: brgyad gang zhe na /
translated: What are the eight?

original: 'di lta ste /🔽ngar 'dzin pa rnam par dag par sbyin pa de byin /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / ngar 'dzin pa rnam par dag par sbyin pa de byin /
translated: They are as follows:🔽They give that generosity with the purity of grasping at “I.”

original: nga yir 'dzin pa rnam par dag par sbyin pa de byin /🔽rgyu rnam par dag par sbyin pa de byin /
analyzed: nga yir 'dzin pa rnam par dag par sbyin pa de byin / rgyu rnam par dag par sbyin pa de byin /
translated: They give that generosity with the purity of grasping at “mine.”🔽They give that generosity with the purity of causes.

original: lta ba rnam par dag par sbyin pa de byin /
analyzed: lta ba rnam par dag par sbyin pa de byin /
translated: They give that generosity with the purity of views.

original: mtshan ma rnam par dag par sbyin pa de byin /
analyzed: mtshan ma rnam par dag par sbyin pa de byin /
translated: He gave that gift with the purity of signs.

original: tha dad pa rnam par dag par sbyin pa de byin /
analyzed: tha dad pa rnam par dag par sbyin pa de byin /
translated: He gave that gift with the purity of distinctions.

original: rnam par smin pa la mi re ba rnam par dag par sbyin pa de byin /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa la mi re ba rnam par dag par sbyin pa de byin /
translated: He gave that gift with the purity of not hoping for ripening.

original: nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa'i sems rnam par dag par sbyin pa de byin te /
analyzed: nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa'i sems rnam par dag par sbyin pa de byin te /
translated: He gave that gift with the purity of a mind equal to space.

original: de rnam par dag pa brgyad po 'di dag gi sgo nas sbyin pa de byin no //
analyzed: de rnam par dag pa brgyad po 'di dag gi sgo nas sbyin pa de byin no //
translated: He gave that gift with these eight purities.

original: ji ltar nam mkha' mtha' med pa de bzhin du sems mtha' med par byas te sbyin pa de byin /
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha' mtha' med pa de bzhin du sems mtha' med par byas te sbyin pa de byin /
translated: “He gave that gift with a mind equal to space, infinite like infinite space.

original: ji ltar nam mkha' rgya che zhing sgrib pa med pa de bzhin du byang chub tu bsngos te sbyin pa de byin /🔽ji ltar nam mkha' la gzugs med pa de bzhin du gzugs thams cad la mi gnas par sbyin pa de byin /
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha' rgya che zhing sgrib pa med pa de bzhin du byang chub tu bsngos te sbyin pa de byin / ji ltar nam mkha' la gzugs med pa de bzhin du gzugs thams cad la mi gnas par sbyin pa de byin /
translated: He gave that gift dedicated to awakening, vast like the vastness of space.🔽He gave that gift without dwelling on any form, formless like space.

original: ji ltar nam mkha' la tshor ba med pa de bzhin du tshor ba thams cad dang bral @336a *//🔽bar sbyin pa de byin /
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha' la tshor ba med pa de bzhin du tshor ba thams cad dang bral @336a *//🔽bar sbyin pa de byin /
translated: He gave that gift free from all feelings, without any feeling, like space.

original: ji ltar nam mkha' la 'du shes med pa de bzhin du 'du shes thams cad kyi mdud pa med par sbyin pa de byin /
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha' la 'du shes med pa de bzhin du 'du shes thams cad kyi mdud pa med par sbyin pa de byin /
translated: Just as space is without conceptualization, give gifts without the knots of all conceptualization.

original: ji ltar nam mkha' 'dus ma byas pa de bzhin du 'dus byas thams cad med par sbyin pa de byin /
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha' 'dus ma byas pa de bzhin du 'dus byas thams cad med par sbyin pa de byin /
translated: Just as space is unconditioned, give gifts without all conditioned things.

original: ji ltar nam mkha' mtshan nyid rnam par rig pa med pa de bzhin du rnam par shes pa mi gnas par sbyin pa de byin /
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha' mtshan nyid rnam par rig pa med pa de bzhin du rnam par shes pa mi gnas par sbyin pa de byin /
translated: Just as space is without the awareness of characteristics, give gifts without consciousness abiding.

original: ji ltar nam mkha' sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad la khyab pa de bzhin du sems can thams cad la byams pas khyab par sbyin pa de byin /
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha' sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad la khyab pa de bzhin du sems can thams cad la byams pas khyab par sbyin pa de byin /
translated: Just as space pervades all buddhafields, give gifts with love pervading all sentient beings.

original: ji ltar nam mkha' mi zad pa de bzhin du dkon mchog gsum gyi rigs mi zad par bsngo zhing sbyin pa de byin /
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha' mi zad pa de bzhin du dkon mchog gsum gyi rigs mi zad par bsngo zhing sbyin pa de byin /
translated: Just as space is inexhaustible, give gifts dedicating them to the inexhaustible lineage of the Three Jewels.

original: ji ltar nam mkha' la mun pa med pa de bzhin du nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi mun pa med par sbyin pa de byin //
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha' la mun pa med pa de bzhin du nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi mun pa med par sbyin pa de byin //
translated: Just as space is without darkness, give gifts without the darkness of all afflictions.

original: ji ltar nam mkha' rtag par rab tu snang ba de bzhin du sems kyi rang bzhin yongs su dag par sbyin pa de byin /
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha' rtag par rab tu snang ba de bzhin du sems kyi rang bzhin yongs su dag par sbyin pa de byin /
translated: Just as space is always radiant, so should you give gifts with the pure nature of mind.

original: ji ltar nam mkha' sems can thams cad kyi go skabs 'byed pa de bzhin du sems can thams cad nye bar 'tsho bar sbyin pa de byin /
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha' sems can thams cad kyi go skabs 'byed pa de bzhin du sems can thams cad nye bar 'tsho bar sbyin pa de byin /
translated: Just as space provides room for all sentient beings, so should you give gifts that sustain all sentient beings.

original: ji ltar nam mkha' la nga yi ba med pa de bzhin du sems can thams cad yid la byed pa thams cad dang bral bar sbyin pa de byin /
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha' la nga yi ba med pa de bzhin du sems can thams cad yid la byed pa thams cad dang bral bar sbyin pa de byin /
translated: Just as space is not owned by anyone, so should you give gifts free of all mental activity.

original: ji ltar sprul pas sprul pa la sbyin pa de byin pa lta bur rnam par mi rtog cing lhun gyis grub ste /
analyzed: ji ltar sprul pas sprul pa la sbyin pa de byin pa lta bur rnam par mi rtog cing lhun gyis grub ste /
translated: Just as an emanation gives gifts to another emanation, so should you give gifts without concepts and spontaneously.

original: @336b sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa dang bral zhing chos thams cad la re ba med pa de ltar gnyis dang bral ba'i phyir sgyu ma'i mtshan nyid kyi ngo bo nyid rnam par dag par byang chub sems dpas sbyin pa de byin te /
analyzed: @336b sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa dang bral zhing chos thams cad la re ba med pa de ltar gnyis dang bral ba'i phyir sgyu ma'i mtshan nyid kyi ngo bo nyid rnam par dag par byang chub sems dpas sbyin pa de byin te /
translated: Free from mind, mentality, and consciousness, and without any hope for any phenomena, you should give gifts in this way, free of duality, in order to purify the nature that is characterized by illusion.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: gang de lta bur sbyin pa yongs su gtong ba de ni /
analyzed: gang de lta bur sbyin pa yongs su gtong ba de ni /
translated: That is how one should give gifts.

original: shes rab kyi ye shes kyis ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi ye shes kyis ni /
translated: With the wisdom of knowledge,🔽one should give up all the afflictions of all sentient beings.

analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa thams cad yongs su 'dor zhing thabs kyi ye shes kyis ni /
translated: With the wisdom of means,

original: sems can thams cad mi gtong ba ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad mi gtong ba ste /
translated: one should not give up on any sentient being.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: de lta bur mi gtong ba'i sems ni /
analyzed: de lta bur mi gtong ba'i sems ni /
translated: that is how one should not give up on any sentient being.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa yin no //
translated: That is the bodhisattvas’ space-like generosity.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po lag na mar me zhes bya ba 'khor de nyid du 'dus par gyur te 'dug pa des bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po lag na mar me zhes bya ba 'khor de nyid du 'dus par gyur te 'dug pa des bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: ” Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Dīpaṃkara, who was present in the assembly, said to the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang dag gi sbyin pa yongs su gtong ba 'di 'dra ba lags /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang dag gi sbyin pa yongs su gtong ba 'di 'dra ba lags /
translated: what kind of generosity is this that the bodhisattvas give?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: ” The Blessed One said,

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Son of noble family,

analyzed: dga' @337b zhing mgu nas rjes su gdung med de //

original: de la zhum pa med de gong ba med //

analyzed: de bas dga' bar mi 'gyur zhum pa med //

original: de ni sems kyi rgyud la mi chags par //

original: rab 'bring tha ma gsum yang med par sbyin //
analyzed: rab 'bring tha ma gsum yang med par sbyin //

original: bsam pa yengs dag dri ma med pa yis //
analyzed: bsam pa yengs dag dri ma med pa yis //

original: thams cad gtong yang rnam par smin mi 'dod //
analyzed: thams cad gtong yang rnam par smin mi 'dod //

original: lus dang tshe ni mi rtag sgyu ma 'dra //

original: longs spyod rmi lam glog bzhin snying po med //
analyzed: longs spyod rmi lam glog bzhin snying po med //

analyzed: 'jig rten kun la snying rje brtse bskyed nas //

analyzed: 'jig rten chos kyis mgos sbyin pa byin //

analyzed: nyon mongs dag phyir bdag gi nor kun gtong //

analyzed: rgyal ba'i tshig gi gnas su 'gyur snyam ste //

original: tshul khrims yon tan gnas nas bsam gtan rnyed //
analyzed: tshul khrims yon tan gnas nas bsam gtan rnyed //

analyzed: bdag blo rnam dag byang chub phyir gtong ngo //

analyzed: ji lta ji ltar byang chub yon tan mthong //

analyzed: chos bzhi dang ldan na /

analyzed: byang chub yongs su dag pa'i phyir smon lam yongs su rdzogs pa ste /

translated: The bodhisattvas’ diligence is to be understood as being of six kinds: the diligence of not being attached to the opposite of the transcendent perfections; the diligence of not being attached to other paths; the diligence of not being attached to the levels; the diligence of not being attached to the accumulations; the diligence of not being attached to the result; and the diligence of not being attached to the two extremes.🔽The diligence of not being attached to the opposite of the transcendent perfections is the diligence of not being attached to the opposite of the transcendent perfections, which is to say, the six negative actions such as stinginess.🔽The diligence of not being attached to other paths is the diligence of not being attached to the paths of the listeners and solitary realizers.🔽The diligence of not being attached to the levels is the diligence of not being attached to the listeners’ and solitary realizers’ levels.

original: brtson 'grus gang gis sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyong bar byed pa'i zhing de'ang nam mkha' dang mtshungs pas rnam par brtags te mi dmigs pa dang / brtson 'grus gang gis thos pa thams cad 'dzin par byed pa de'ang sgra brag ca dang mtshungs par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba dang /

translated: The diligence of not being attached to the accumulations is the diligence of not being attached to the listeners’ and solitary realizers’ accumulations of merit and wisdom.🔽The diligence of not being attached to the result is the diligence of not being attached to the listeners’ and solitary realizers’ results of their paths.🔽The diligence of not being attached to the two extremes is the diligence of not being attached to the extremes of samsara and nirvana.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' gnas @355b gtsang ma'i ris kyi lha rnams rjes su dran no //🔽yang skye ba gcig gis thogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dga' ldan gyi gnas na gang dag 'khod pa de dag ni /

original: spyi bo lta bu bcus rjes su dran te /
analyzed: spyi bo lta bu bcus rjes su dran te /

original: bcu gang zhe na /

original: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad kyi nang na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa spyi bor gyur pa dang / mngon par shes pa thams cad kyi nang na mi nyams pa'i mngon par shes pa dang / sa thams cad kyi nang na dbang bskur ba'i sa dang /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad kyi nang na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa spyi bor gyur pa dang / mngon par shes pa thams cad kyi nang na mi nyams pa'i mngon par shes pa dang / sa thams cad kyi nang na dbang bskur ba'i sa dang /

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos thams cad kyi nang na yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / ting nge 'dzin mi nyams pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa'i nang na don dang spobs pa rgyun mi 'chad pa dang / shes pa thams cad kyi nang na chags pa med pa'i ye shes la 'jug pa dang /

translated: Among all the consciousnesses, it is the engagement in the wisdom of nonattachment.🔽Among all the faculties, it is the knowledge of the superior, middling, and inferior.🔽It is the wisdom that follows the powers and fearlessnesses.

original: dbang po thams cad kyi nang na rab 'bring tha ma la 'jug pa shes pa dang / stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la snang ba'i ye shes rjes su 'gro ba dang / spyan thams cad kyi nang na sangs rgyas kyi spyan kun tu gzigs pa dang /

translated: Among all the eyes, it is the all-seeing eye of the Buddha.🔽It is the wisdom that is like all the qualities of the Buddha being in the palm of one’s hand.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad 'di dag gi lag mthil du song ba ltar 'dug pa dang / byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug nas sems kyi skad cig gcig dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyis mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'o //

translated: It is the wisdom that is seated at the heart of awakening and is fully awakened in a single instant of awareness.

analyzed: mu stegs can gzhan thams cad tshar gcod; nyon mongs pa thams cad zhi bar byed cing de dag la chos dkon mchog rab tu sgrog pa de ltar 'dzin to //
translated: They defeat all other tīrthikas. They pacify all afflictions and proclaim the precious Dharma to them.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi chos dkon mchog gi mdzod 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: the bodhisattvas hold the precious Dharma of the blessed buddhas.

original: yang rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: yang rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

analyzed: chos gang gi ngo bo nyid du ngas chos rnams mngon par sangs rgyas pa de'i ngo bo nyid du byang chub sems dpas chos rnams gzung bar bya'o //
translated: the bodhisattvas should hold all phenomena in the same way that I have realized the intrinsic nature of phenomena.

original: yang ji lta bur de bzhin gshegs pas chos rnams mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas she na /🔽yongs su ma grub pa'i tshul gyis sgyu ma'i ngo bo nyid dang / yul las shin tu 'das pa'i tshul gyis rmi lam gyi ngo bo nyid dang / shin tu skye ba med pa'i tshul gyis smig rgyu'i ngo bo nyid dang / mi 'pho ba'i tshul gyis mig yor gyi ngo bo nyid dang /
analyzed: yang ji lta bur de bzhin gshegs pas chos rnams mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas she na / yongs su ma grub pa'i tshul gyis sgyu ma'i ngo bo nyid dang / yul las shin tu 'das pa'i tshul gyis rmi lam gyi ngo bo nyid dang / shin tu skye ba med pa'i tshul gyis smig rgyu'i ngo bo nyid dang / mi 'pho ba'i tshul gyis mig yor gyi ngo bo nyid dang /
translated: How does the Tathāgata fully awaken to dharmas?🔽By way of the nature of an illusion, which is not fully established; by way of the nature of a dream, which is utterly beyond objects; by way of the nature of a mirage, which is utterly non-arisen; by way of the nature of an optical illusion, which is utterly non-transmigrating;

original: rang bzhin med pa'i tshul gyis gzugs brnyan gyi ngo bo nyid dang / rag las pa'i tshul gyis stong pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i tshul @358b gyis mtshan ma med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / sems chags pa med pa'i tshul gyis smon pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang /
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa'i tshul gyis gzugs brnyan gyi ngo bo nyid dang / rag las pa'i tshul gyis stong pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i tshul @358b gyis mtshan ma med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / sems chags pa med pa'i tshul gyis smon pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang /
translated: by way of the nature of a reflection, which is essenceless; by way of the nature of emptiness, which is dependent; by way of the nature of signlessness, which is non-conceptual; by way of the nature of wishlessness, which is the non-attachment of mind;

original: 'dod chags thams cad dang bral ba'i tshul gyis 'dod chags med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / grangs thams cad las 'das pa'i tshul gyis 'dus ma byas pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: 'dod chags thams cad dang bral ba'i tshul gyis 'dod chags med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / grangs thams cad las 'das pa'i tshul gyis 'dus ma byas pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
translated: the nature of being free from desire, in the sense of being free from all desires; and the nature of being unconditioned, in the sense of being beyond all enumeration.

original: de ltar rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: de ltar rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Son of noble family,

original: tha snyad du gzhan rnam par rig pa la brten nas de 'dra ba chos de ngas mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: tha snyad du gzhan rnam par rig pa la brten nas de 'dra ba chos de ngas mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /

original: gang chos de'i ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid de ni /
analyzed: gang chos de'i ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid de ni /
translated: The defining characteristic of the essence of that Dharma

analyzed: de la chos rnams 'dzin par 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpas de lta bu'i ngo bo nyid kyi chos rnams mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par bya ste /
translated: Those bodhisattvas who wish to uphold the Dharma should fully awaken to the Dharma that has such an essence.

original: yi ge dang / nges pa'i tshig gis kyang sems can gzhan rnams dang / gang zag gzhan dag la bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: yi ge dang / nges pa'i tshig gis kyang sems can gzhan rnams dang / gang zag gzhan dag la bstan par bya'o //
translated: They should teach it to other sentient beings and other individuals using words and definitions.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Son of noble family,

original: de la ji ltar na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na /
translated: how is it that

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' thog ma nas sems can rnam par dag pas sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed ce na / rigs kyi bu /

analyzed: sems can gyi khams ni /

analyzed: de la sems can rnams kyi rtse ba'i dngos po med de /

translated: When bodhisattvas understand that the root of all phenomena is severed, they bring sentient beings to full maturity without giving rise to the view of a self,

original: sems can du lta bar ma yin //
analyzed: sems can du lta bar ma yin //
translated: the view of a sentient being,

original: srog tu lta bar ma yin /
analyzed: srog tu lta bar ma yin /
translated: the view of a life force,

analyzed: gang zag tu lta bar yang mi 'gyur ro // yang de 'di @359a *// snyam du sems te / sems can zhes bya ba 'di ni /
translated: or the view of a person.

original: phyin ci log ste /
analyzed: phyin ci log ste /
translated: They think, ‘Sentient beings are a mistake.

original: de la byang chub sems dpas med pa phyin ci log las byung ba'i nyon mongs pa rab tu spang ba'i phyir sems can rnams la chos ston te /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpas med pa phyin ci log las byung ba'i nyon mongs pa rab tu spang ba'i phyir sems can rnams la chos ston te /

original: dngos po gang yang chud mi gzon to //
analyzed: dngos po gang yang chud mi gzon to //

original: sems can med cing sems can dben pas sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed de /
analyzed: sems can med cing sems can dben pas sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed de /
translated: Since sentient beings do not exist and are void, they bring sentient beings to full maturity.

analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' thog ma nas rnam par dag pas sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed do //
translated: In this way, bodhisattvas bring sentient beings to full maturity through their primordial purity.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Son of noble family,

original: de la ji ltar na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na /
translated: how is it that

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' tshul bzhin la rab tu sbyor bas sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yang dag par sdud ce na /

analyzed: sbyin pa ni /

analyzed: longs spyod chen po'i rgyu ste /

analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad sdud pa'i rgyu ste / byang chub sems dpas brtson 'grus ba rtsams nas dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad yang dag par sgrub cing dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad yang dag par grub pa'i brtson 'grus de'ang thams cad mkhyen par bsdos nas brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs
translated: Diligence is the cause for gathering all the qualities of the buddhas.🔽Having begun their diligence, bodhisattvas accomplish all the roots of virtue.

original: par byed do //
analyzed: par byed do //

original: bsam gtan ni /
analyzed: bsam gtan ni /

analyzed: zhi gnas kyi tshogs de'ang thams cad mkhyen par bsngos nas bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do // thos pa ni /

original: shes rab che ba'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: shes rab che ba'i rgyu ste /

analyzed: thos pa de'ang thams cad mkhyen par bsngos nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //

analyzed: rgyu dang / rkyen de ni /

analyzed: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //

analyzed: gzhan yang tshul bzhin zhes bya ba la chos thams cad kyi tshul bzhin ni /
translated: Moreover, proper means that the proper way of all phenomena is

analyzed: ji ltar bdag ni /

analyzed: bdag med pa de bzhin du sems can thams cad la bdag med do //

analyzed: bdag stong pa de bzhin du chos thams cad stong ngo //

analyzed: ji ltar bdag ming du btags pa tsam du zad pa de bzhin du chos thams cad kyang ming du btags pa tsam du zad do //

analyzed: de ltar tshul bzhin la rab tu sbyor ba'i byang chub sems dpa' ni /

analyzed: gang chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid de ni /

analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid do //

analyzed: de ltar tshul bzhin la sbyor ba'i byang chub sems dpa' ni /
translated: The bodhisattva who thus applies himself properly

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams yang dag par sgrub bo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams yang dag par sgrub bo //

analyzed: de ji ltar na /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' mngon par shes pa las ma nyams shing chos thams cad la dbang byed pa yin zhe na /

original: 'di la rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: 'di la rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: In this regard, noble son,

original: dge sbyong ngam /
analyzed: dge sbyong ngam /

analyzed: bram ze 'jig tshogs @360b la lta ba ma bcom pas mngon par shes pa rnams las nyams par yang 'gyur ro // yang byang chub sems dpa' ni /

original: shes rab dang ldan /
analyzed: shes rab dang ldan /

original: blo dang ldan /
analyzed: blo dang ldan /
translated: endowed with intelligence,

analyzed: bzod pa dang ldan; tshul khrims dang ldan te /

original: sems dben te /
analyzed: sems dben te /

analyzed: 'di 'dra ba'i ye shes kyis nang nye bar 'gro zhing phyi rol du mi rgyu ba /

analyzed: cang shes pa'i sems dang ldan pa /

original: dga' ba'i sems dang ldan pa /
analyzed: dga' ba'i sems dang ldan pa /

original: bsod nams kyi tshogs bsags pa /

original: kun 'dzin pa dang / klog pa dang / ston pa la le lo med pa dang; chos la slob dpon gyi dpe mkhyud med cing zang zing med par chos sbyin pa dang / shes rab kyi rtsa ba'i gnas thos pa dang / tshul bzhin gyi chos la sbyor ba dang /
analyzed: kun 'dzin pa dang / klog pa dang / ston pa la le lo med pa dang; chos la slob dpon gyi dpe mkhyud med cing zang zing med par chos sbyin pa dang / shes rab kyi rtsa ba'i gnas thos pa dang / tshul bzhin gyi chos la sbyor ba dang /
translated: It is to be without laziness in upholding, reading, and teaching. It is to give the gift of Dharma without the miserliness of a teacher and without material desires. It is to listen to the root of wisdom. It is to apply oneself correctly to the Dharma.

original: ji ltar thos pa'i chos la so sor brtag pa'i phyir mang du thos pa mu med par byas pa dang / tshangs par spyod pa la gnas pa med par byas pa dang / rtag tu dben pa la sems gzhol ba dang / rjes su dran pa drug rjes su dran pa dang /
analyzed: ji ltar thos pa'i chos la so sor brtag pa'i phyir mang du thos pa mu med par byas pa dang / tshangs par spyod pa la gnas pa med par byas pa dang / rtag tu dben pa la sems gzhol ba dang / rjes su dran pa drug rjes su dran pa dang /
translated: It is to be insatiable in listening to the Dharma in order to examine it as one has heard it. It is to be insatiable in pure conduct. It is to be insatiable in always directing one’s mind to solitude. It is to be insatiable in recollecting the six recollections.

original: yang dag par chags par 'gyur ba drug @368b mi 'der ba dang / gus par bya ba'i gnas drug yongs su mi gtong ba dang / sems can thams cad la khong khro ba med pa'i sems kyis chos la sbyor ba dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang mi 'gal ba'i las dang /
analyzed: yang dag par chags par 'gyur ba drug @368b mi 'der ba dang / gus par bya ba'i gnas drug yongs su mi gtong ba dang / sems can thams cad la khong khro ba med pa'i sems kyis chos la sbyor ba dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang mi 'gal ba'i las dang /
translated: It is to not be cold toward the six that are to be truly cherished. It is to not abandon the six that are worthy of respect. It is to apply oneself to the Dharma with a mind that is free of anger toward any being.🔽It is to engage in actions that are not in contradiction with dependent origination.

original: bya ba la 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum la sems nges par rtog pa la mi skrag pa dang / 'phags pa'i rigs dang sbyangs pa'i yon tan kun 'dzin pas yongs su mi 'chad pa dang / dam pa'i chos yongs su gzung ba la sems zhum pa med pa dang /
analyzed: bya ba la 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum la sems nges par rtog pa la mi skrag pa dang / 'phags pa'i rigs dang sbyangs pa'i yon tan kun 'dzin pas yongs su mi 'chad pa dang / dam pa'i chos yongs su gzung ba la sems zhum pa med pa dang /
translated: It is to not be afraid of the mind being certain about the three doors of liberation. It is to not be interrupted by upholding the noble family and the qualities of training. It is to be undaunted in upholding the sublime Dharma.

original: sems can la lta bas snying rje che ba dang / chos la lta bas lus dang srog 'dor ba dang / ye shes la lta bas rtag tu nga rgyal med pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba la yongs su mi skyo ba ste /
analyzed: sems can la lta bas snying rje che ba dang / chos la lta bas lus dang srog 'dor ba dang / ye shes la lta bas rtag tu nga rgyal med pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba la yongs su mi skyo ba ste /
translated: Compassion is great because of looking at sentient beings, one gives up body and life because of looking at the Dharma, one is always free of pride because of looking at gnosis, and one never tires of bringing sentient beings to full maturity.
